Sentencas: At any given cell operating condition, a fuel map can be developed to predict the effect of a fuel containing carbon, hydrogen, oxygen and inert gas atoms on the maximum cell efficiency (MCE) of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Developing fuel map to predict the effect of fuel composition on the maximum efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: To create a fuel map, a thermodynamic model is developed to obtain the fuels that would yield identical MCE for SOFCs.
Titulo: Developing fuel map to predict the effect of fuel composition on the maximum efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These fuels make a continuous curve in the ternary coordinate system.
Titulo: Developing fuel map to predict the effect of fuel composition on the maximum efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A fuel map is established by developing continuous fuel curves for different MCEs at the same operating condition of a cell and representing them in the carbon-hydrogen-oxygen (C-H-O) ternary diagram.
Titulo: Developing fuel map to predict the effect of fuel composition on the maximum efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The graphical representation of fuel maps can be applied to predict the effect of the fuel composition and fuel processor on the MCE of SOFCs.
Titulo: Developing fuel map to predict the effect of fuel composition on the maximum efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: As a general result, among the fuels that can be directly utilized in SOFCs, at the same temperature and pressure, the one located at the intersection of the H-C axis and the carbon deposition boundary (CDB) curve in the C-H-O ternary diagram provides the highest MCE.
Titulo: Developing fuel map to predict the effect of fuel composition on the maximum efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For any fuel that can be indirectly utilized in SOFCs, the steam reforming fuel processor always yields a higher MCE than auto-thermal reforming or partial oxidation fuel processors at the same anode inlet fuel temperature.
Titulo: Developing fuel map to predict the effect of fuel composition on the maximum efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells
Developing fuel map to predict the effect of fuel composition on the maximum efficiency of solid oxide fuel cells
